text.p: Football star Tony Adams's reported confession to his Arsenal team mates of his drink problem marks the latest incident in a career marked by sporting achievement and personal scandals.
Within five months of joining Arsenal, at the age of 17, Adams made his first team debut at Highbury.
At 21, he was offered the captaincy by then Arsenal manager George Graham, making him the club's youngest captain.

Since then he has lifted more silverware than any previous Arsenal skipper, including the 1987 and 1993 League Cups; 1989 and 1990 league championships; 1993 F.A. Cup; and 1994 European Cup Winners' Cup.
Adams's England debut came at the age of 20, an impressive one against Spain, leading then manager Bobby Robson to compare him hastily with Bobby Moore.
His reputation took a battering a year later at the European championship finals when Marco Van Basten turned him every which way in scoring a hat-trick for Holland.
Angry fans began taunting him with donkey noises, a taunt that was periodically surfaced throughout his career.
He was subsequently omitted from the World Cup squad of 1990 and was imprisoned the following Christmas for four months for reckless driving after being three times over the alcohol limit.
Restored to England colours by Graham Taylor, he was found wanting in a match against Ireland and another exile followed.
But his club form remained consistent and he became an automatic choice under Terry Venables, who made him captain after David Platt was demoted.
Adams, winner of 45 England caps, led an England side that captured the nation's hearts with their progress to the semifinals of Euro 96 before losing a penalty shoot-out with Germany.
But the player has made several appearances in newspapers because of the low-points in his career -- starting with his drink-driving conviction.
He hit the headlines again in 1993 when he needed 29 stitches to a head wound after falling down stairs at a nightclub.
Later that year he was involved with team mate Ray Parlour in an incident at an Essex pizza restaurant when customers were sprayed with a fire extinguisher.
This year -- on Cup Final day -- he was reported to have gone on a 16-hour pub crawl, ending up on stage with a stripper.
Only last week there were fresh reports of disharmony in his Essex household, with Adams and his wife Jane, 30, on the verge of splitting.
The star and his wife have three children. The couple met in a pub and married in July 1992.
